title: West Beach fire burns through 200 sq m of park land
text:
A fire that destroyed 200 sq m of vegetation in West Beach is being investigated by police.

At around 3.30pm Saturday SA Police and fire crews attended the scene, after reports of high flames in gum trees at Apex Park, off Burbridge Rd.

Three trucks attended the scene, and 12 firefighters took 30 minutes to control the blaze.

Flames were reported to reach up to three metres high.

An MFS spokesman said they are unaware of how the fire started but are not treating it as suspicious.

Police are currently investigating the situation, encouraging anyone with information to call crime stoppers on 1800 333 000.
description: A fire at West Beach has burnt 200 sqm of park land on Saturday afternoon. Police are investigating.
